Symptom: headache, acidity, blurred and distorted vision, depression, excessive hunger, headache, indigestion, irritability, stiff neck, visual disturbances
Precaution: Avoid triggers, Get adequate rest, Stay hydrated
Tests: MRI, CT scan, Blood tests (to rule out other causes)
Disease_Description: A neurological condition causing severe headaches and sensory disturbances.
Consultation_Description: Consult a neurologist if headaches are frequent or severely impact daily life.
Nutrition_Description: Maintain a diet rich in magnesium, avoid caffeine and alcohol.

Symptom: intrusive thoughts, compulsive behaviors, anxiety
Precaution: Seek therapy, Practice relaxation techniques, Avoid stress
Tests: Psychological evaluation, Self-reported questionnaires, Brain imaging (in some cases)
Disease_Description: A mental health disorder characterized by persistent, unwanted thoughts and repetitive behaviors.
Consultation_Description: Seek psychiatric consultation if compulsions interfere with daily activities.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a balanced diet to support brain function; avoid excessive caffeine.

Symptom: joint pain, stiffness, reduced flexibility, swelling, urine discoloration, severe abdominal pain, vomiting
Precaution: Maintain a healthy weight, Exercise regularly, Avoid heavy lifting
Tests: X-ray, MRI, Joint aspiration (for fluid analysis)
Disease_Description: A degenerative joint disease leading to pain and stiffness.
Consultation_Description: Consult an orthopedic specialist if pain persists or mobility is affected.
Nutrition_Description: Consume anti-inflammatory foods like fatty fish, turmeric, and green leafy vegetables.

Symptom: fragile bones, back pain, loss of height, fractures, blood in urine, sharp back pain, nausea
Precaution: Get regular bone density tests, Eat calcium-rich foods, Avoid smoking
Tests: Bone mineral density (BMD) test, X-ray, CT scan
Disease_Description: A condition where bones become weak and brittle.
Consultation_Description: Seek an endocrinologist for long-term bone health management.
Nutrition_Description: Increase calcium and vitamin D intake; avoid excessive caffeine and alcohol.

Symptom: jaundice, weight loss, back pain
Precaution: Avoid alcohol, Maintain a healthy diet, Get regular check-ups
Tests: CT scan, MRI, Endoscopic ultrasound, CA 19-9 blood test
Treatment Duration: Ongoing (depends on stage, from months to years)
Disease_Description: A type of cancer that begins in the pancreas and spreads aggressively.
Consultation_Description: Consult an oncologist if unexplained weight loss or jaundice occurs.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a high-antioxidant, low-fat diet with plenty of fruits and vegetables.

Symptom: altered sensorium, headache, vomiting, weakness of one body side
Precaution: Get medical help immediately, Stay calm, Monitor vitals
Tests: CT scan, MRI, Blood tests (coagulation profile)
Treatment Duration: Variable (depends on recovery process, from weeks to lifelong)
Disease_Description: Loss of muscle function due to brain damage from a hemorrhage.
Consultation_Description: Seek emergency medical care if sudden weakness or loss of function occurs.
Nutrition_Description: Consume foods rich in omega-3s and antioxidants to support brain health.

Symptom: abdominal pain, indigestion, internal itching, loss of appetite, passage of gases, vomiting
Precaution: Avoid spicy foods, Eat smaller meals, Take medications as prescribed
Tests: Endoscopy, H. pylori test, Barium swallow
Disease_Description: A condition where sores develop on the lining of the stomach or small intestine.
Consultation_Description: Consult a gastroenterologist if symptoms persist despite treatment.
Nutrition_Description: Eat probiotic-rich foods, avoid acidic and spicy foods.

Symptom: breathlessness, chest pain, chills, cough, fast heart rate, fatigue, high fever, malaise, phlegm, rusty sputum, sweating
Precaution: Get vaccinated, Avoid smoking, Rest and hydrate
Tests: Chest X-ray, Blood culture, Sputum culture
Disease_Description: An infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, causing difficulty in breathing.
Consultation_Description: Seek immediate medical attention if breathing difficulties worsen.
Nutrition_Description: Consume warm fluids, include vitamin C-rich foods in the diet.

Symptom: irregular periods, acne, weight gain, infertility, tremors, slow movements, rigid muscles, poor balance
Precaution: Maintain a healthy weight, Exercise regularly, Monitor hormone levels
Tests: Blood tests (hormones), Ultrasound, Glucose tolerance test
Disease_Description: A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts.
Consultation_Description: Consult a gynecologist for hormone management and fertility planning.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a low-carb, high-fiber diet; avoid processed sugars.

Symptom: urinary issues, pelvic pain, blood in urine, unexplained fatigue, weight changes, mood swings
Precaution: Get regular screenings, Avoid alcohol, Maintain a healthy diet
Tests: PSA blood test, Digital rectal exam (DRE), Biopsy
Treatment Duration: Variable (depends on stage, from months to years)
Disease_Description: A cancer affecting the prostate gland, common in older men.
Consultation_Description: Consult a urologist or oncologist for early detection and treatment options.
Nutrition_Description: Eat a diet rich in tomatoes, cruciferous vegetables, and healthy fats.

Symptom: inflammatory nails, joint pain, silver like dusting, skin peeling, skin rash, small dents in nails
Precaution: Avoid triggers, Use moisturizers, Practice stress management
Tests: Skin biopsy, Blood tests (for inflammation)
Disease_Description: A chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid skin cell turnover leading to scaling and inflammation.
Consultation_Description: Consult a dermatologist for appropriate treatment and monitoring.
Nutrition_Description: Consume anti-inflammatory foods such as fish, nuts, and leafy greens.

Symptom: joint pain, swelling, stiffness, fatigue, fever, redness, itching, difficulty swallowing
Precaution: Get regular check-ups, Avoid smoking, Exercise regularly
Tests: Blood tests (rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP), X-ray, Ultrasound
Disease_Description: An autoimmune disorder causing joint inflammation and damage.
Consultation_Description: Seek rheumatologist consultation for long-term joint health management.
Nutrition_Description: Eat omega-3-rich foods and avoid processed sugars.

Symptom: bone pain, delayed growth, skeletal deformities
Precaution: Get adequate sunlight, Eat a balanced diet, Get regular bone check-ups
Tests: Blood tests (vitamin D, calcium, phosphate), X-ray
Disease_Description: A disease caused by vitamin D deficiency leading to weakened bones.
Consultation_Description: Pediatric or endocrinology consultation for growth monitoring and supplementation.
Nutrition_Description: Include dairy products, fish, and fortified cereals in the diet.

Symptom: facial redness, swelling, visible blood vessels, difficulty swallowing, chest tightness, coughing blood
Precaution: Avoid triggers like heat and stress, Use gentle skincare products, Wear sunscreen
Tests: Skin examination, Blood tests (inflammatory markers)
Disease_Description: A chronic skin condition causing redness and visible blood vessels on the face.
Consultation_Description: Consult a dermatologist if persistent redness or flare-ups occur.
Nutrition_Description: Avoid spicy foods, alcohol, and caffeine.

Symptom: hallucinations, delusions, disorganized speech
Precaution: Seek therapy, Avoid stress, Stay consistent with medication
Tests: Psychological evaluation, MRI, CT scan
Disease_Description: A severe mental disorder affecting thoughts, emotions, and behavior.
Consultation_Description: Regular psychiatric consultation is crucial for medication and therapy.
Nutrition_Description: Maintain a well-balanced diet with omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidants.

Symptom: new moles, skin changes, bleeding lesions, inability to focus, social withdrawal, restlessness
Precaution: Wear sunscreen, Avoid tanning beds, Regular skin check-ups
Tests: Skin biopsy, Dermoscopy, MRI
Treatment Duration: Variable (depends on stage, from months to years)
Disease_Description: Abnormal growth of skin cells, often due to UV exposure.
Consultation_Description: Dermatologist consultation for early detection and treatment.
Nutrition_Description: Eat antioxidant-rich foods like berries and leafy greens.

Symptom: loud snoring, gasping during sleep, daytime fatigue, severe dehydration, vomiting, lethargy
Precaution: Use a CPAP machine, Avoid alcohol, Sleep on your side
Tests: Polysomnography (sleep study), Home sleep apnea test (HSAT)
Disease_Description: A sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts.
Consultation_Description: Consult a sleep specialist for management and therapy.
Nutrition_Description: Avoid heavy meals before bedtime and reduce caffeine intake.

Symptom: bloating, nausea, weight loss, stomach pain
Precaution: Avoid smoking, Limit alcohol intake, Eat a healthy diet
Tests: Endoscopy, Biopsy, CT scan
Treatment Duration: Variable (depends on stage, from months to years)
Disease_Description: A cancer that forms in the stomach lining.
Consultation_Description: Gastroenterology consultation for early detection and treatment.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a diet high in fiber and antioxidants, avoid processed foods.

Symptom: sudden numbness, confusion, vision problems, difficulty speaking, persistent fatigue, muscle stiffness, tremors
Precaution: Avoid smoking, Manage blood pressure, Get regular exercise
Tests: CT scan, MRI, Carotid ultrasound
Treatment Duration: Variable (depends on recovery, from weeks to lifelong)
Disease_Description: A medical emergency where blood flow to the brain is disrupted.
Consultation_Description: Seek immediate emergency medical care if symptoms appear.
Nutrition_Description: Consume heart-healthy foods such as whole grains, fruits, and vegetables.

Symptom: blood in sputum, breathlessness, chest pain, chills, cough, fatigue, high fever, loss of appetite, malaise, mild fever, phlegm, sweating, swelled lymph nodes, vomiting, weight loss, yellowing of eyes
Precaution: Get vaccinated, Avoid close contact with infected individuals, Regular medical check-ups
Tests: Tuberculin skin test (TST), Chest X-ray, Sputum smear microscopy
Disease_Description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.
Consultation_Description: Pulmonology consultation for appropriate treatment and monitoring.
Nutrition_Description: Maintain a protein-rich diet with adequate vitamins and minerals.

Symptom: abdominal pain, belly pain, chills, constipation, diarrhoea, fatigue, headache, high fever, nausea, toxic look (typhos), vomiting
Precaution: Drink clean water, Avoid uncooked food, Maintain good hygiene
Tests: Blood culture, Widal test, Stool culture
Disease_Description: A bacterial infection caused by Salmonella Typhi, primarily spread through contaminated food and water.
Consultation_Description: Seek medical help if high fever persists for more than a few days or symptoms worsen. Consult a general physician or infectious disease specialist.
Nutrition_Description: Consume a soft, high-calorie diet with fluids. Avoid spicy and fried foods. Increase intake of boiled vegetables and fresh fruits.

Symptom: abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, diarrhea, recurrent infections, slow wound healing, dizziness
Precaution: Avoid high-fat foods, Stress management, Take prescribed medication
Tests: Colonoscopy, Blood tests (inflammation markers), Stool sample
Disease_Description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) causing inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.
Consultation_Description: Consult a gastroenterologist if symptoms persist or worsen. Regular follow-ups are necessary for long-term management.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a low-fiber, low-fat diet during flare-ups. Eat easily digestible foods like cooked vegetables, lean proteins, and probiotics.

Symptom: bladder discomfort, burning micturition, continuous feel of urine, foul smell of urine
Precaution: Stay hydrated, Avoid holding urine, Practice good hygiene
Tests: Urine culture, Urinalysis, Blood tests (if needed)
Disease_Description: A bacterial infection affecting the urinary system, including the bladder and urethra.
Consultation_Description: Consult a general physician if experiencing painful urination, frequent urination, or cloudy urine.
Nutrition_Description: Drink plenty of water and cranberry juice. Avoid caffeine, alcohol, and spicy foods to prevent irritation.

Symptom: frequent urination, burning sensation, cloudy urine
Precaution: Drink plenty of water, Avoid tight clothing, Wipe front to back
Tests: Urine culture, Urinalysis, Blood tests (if needed)
Disease_Description: A common bacterial infection affecting the urinary tract, leading to discomfort and frequent urination.
Consultation_Description: Seek medical attention if symptoms persist for more than a few days. A urologist or general physician can diagnose and treat UTIs.
Nutrition_Description: Increase water intake and consume probiotic-rich foods like yogurt. Avoid acidic and spicy foods.

Symptom: bruising, cramps, fatigue, obesity, prominent veins on calf, swollen blood vessels, swollen legs
Precaution: Elevate legs, Avoid prolonged standing, Exercise regularly
Tests: Ultrasound, Doppler test, Physical examination
Disease_Description: Enlarged, twisted veins caused by weakened vein walls and valves, often in the legs.
Consultation_Description: Consult a vascular specialist if swelling, pain, or skin changes occur.
Nutrition_Description: Consume high-fiber foods and stay hydrated. Include foods rich in flavonoids like berries and citrus fruits.

Symptom: white patches of skin, loss of pigment, persistent bloating, nausea, irregular periods
Precaution: Protect skin from sun, Avoid stress, Seek medical advice regularly
Tests: Physical examination, Skin biopsy, Blood tests (for autoimmune conditions)
Disease_Description: A skin condition causing loss of pigmentation due to immune system attack on melanocytes.
Consultation_Description: Consult a dermatologist for early treatment and to prevent further spread of white patches.
Nutrition_Description: Eat antioxidant-rich foods like fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. Avoid processed foods and gluten if sensitive.

Symptom: severe coughing fits, vomiting, fatigue
Precaution: Get vaccinated, Avoid close contact with infected individuals, Cover mouth while coughing
Tests: PCR test, Nasal swab, Blood test (for antibodies)
Disease_Description: A highly contagious bacterial infection that causes severe coughing fits.
Consultation_Description: Seek medical help if coughing fits persist or breathing difficulty occurs. Pediatricians or general physicians can provide treatment.
Nutrition_Description: Stay hydrated with warm fluids like herbal teas and broths. Avoid dairy if it worsens mucus production.

Symptom: sneezing, runny nose, sore throat, mild fever
Precaution: Rest, Drink plenty of fluids, Avoid close contact with sick individuals
Tests: Physical examination, PCR test (if needed), Rapid antigen test
Disease_Description: A viral respiratory infection causing mild symptoms like sneezing and sore throat.
Consultation_Description: Consult a doctor if symptoms last longer than 10 days or if breathing difficulties arise.
Nutrition_Description: Consume warm fluids, honey, and citrus fruits for vitamin C. Avoid cold drinks and junk food.

Symptom: fever, chills, body aches, fatigue, sore throat
Precaution: Get vaccinated, Avoid close contact with sick individuals, Wash hands regularly
Tests: PCR test, Rapid antigen test, Chest X-ray (if complications occur)
Disease_Description: A contagious viral infection causing fever, chills, and body aches.
Consultation_Description: Visit a doctor if fever is persistent or if breathing problems occur. High-risk individuals should seek early treatment.
Nutrition_Description: Increase fluid intake and consume nutrient-rich foods like chicken soup, citrus fruits, and garlic. Avoid processed foods.

Symptom: headache, dizziness, blurred vision, chest pain
Precaution: Monitor blood pressure, Reduce salt intake, Exercise regularly
Tests: Blood pressure measurement, Blood tests (kidney function), ECG
Disease_Description: A chronic condition where high blood pressure increases the risk of heart disease and stroke.
Consultation_Description: Consult a cardiologist or general physician for regular monitoring and medication adjustments.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a low-sodium, high-potassium diet. Eat leafy greens, berries, and whole grains. Avoid processed and salty foods.

Symptom: excessive thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, weight loss
Precaution: Monitor blood sugar, Eat a balanced diet, Exercise regularly
Tests: Fasting blood glucose, HbA1c, Urine tests (for ketones)
Disease_Description: A chronic metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels due to insulin deficiency or resistance.
Consultation_Description: Consult an endocrinologist or general physician for regular monitoring and medication adjustments.
Nutrition_Description: Follow a low-glycemic diet rich in whole grains, lean proteins, and fiber. Avoid sugary and processed foods.

Symptom: nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain
Precaution: Drink clean water, Avoid contaminated food, Rest and hydrate
Tests: Stool culture, Blood tests (if dehydration is severe), PCR test (if bacterial)
Disease_Description: An illness caused by consuming contaminated food or water, leading to gastrointestinal distress.
Consultation_Description: Seek medical attention if symptoms persist for more than 48 hours or if dehydration occurs.
Nutrition_Description: Consume bland foods like rice, bananas, and toast. Avoid dairy and fatty foods until recovery.

Symptom: pain in head, sensitivity to light, nausea
Precaution: Rest in a quiet, dark room, Stay hydrated, Avoid stress
Tests: MRI, CT scan, Blood tests (if symptoms persist)
Disease_Description: A common condition with various causes, including tension, migraines, or underlying health issues.
Consultation_Description: Consult a neurologist or general physician if headaches are frequent or severe.
Nutrition_Description: Stay hydrated, avoid caffeine overuse, and maintain a balanced diet. Magnesium-rich foods may help.

Symptom: high body temperature, sweating, shivering, weakness
Precaution: Stay hydrated, Rest, Avoid overheating
Tests: Blood tests (to identify the cause), Urine test, Chest X-ray (if pneumonia suspected)
Disease_Description: A temporary rise in body temperature often due to infections or inflammation.
Consultation_Description: Consult a doctor if fever persists beyond three days or is accompanied by severe symptoms.
Nutrition_Description: Drink plenty of fluids like herbal teas and broths. Eat light, easily digestible foods.

Symptom: bloating, nausea, stomach pain, heartburn
Precaution: Avoid spicy foods, Eat smaller meals, Avoid late-night eating
Tests: Endoscopy, Blood tests (for H. pylori), Stool test
Disease_Description: A common digestive issue caused by overeating, stress, or underlying conditions like acid reflux.
Consultation_Description: Consult a gastroenterologist if symptoms persist or worsen.
Nutrition_Description: Eat fiber-rich foods, avoid greasy and spicy meals, and chew food thoroughly. Include probiotics in diet.

Symptom: fever, headache, cold, cough, body aches
Precaution: Rest, Drink plenty of fluids, Avoid contact with others
Tests: Blood tests (for viral infection), Physical examination
Disease_Description: A fever caused by viral infections, often accompanied by respiratory or body aches.
Consultation_Description: Consult a general physician initially. If complications develop, an infectious disease specialist may be needed.
Nutrition_Description: Stay hydrated with herbal teas and soups. Consume vitamin C-rich foods like citrus fruits and leafy greens.
